We support you with some of FAQs that will avoid and protect you
I am being sexually harassed now, what should I do?

• We will send a distress signal, we are looking for nearby advocates and your trusted contacts will also be notified.
 • Meanwhile, follow our instructions.
 • Try to get attention to your situation by loudly asking for help and stating what happened exactly “Sexual Harassment”
 • Ask people to help you by taking him to the nearest police station and to testify while filing the official sexual harassment report.
I have been sexually harassed and I am now at the police station, what should I do?

• We will send a distress signal, we will look for nearby advocates and your trusted contacts will also be notified.
 • Meanwhile, follow our instructions.
 • You should ask for the human rights officer and explain you want to file a sexual harassment complaint.
 • Present the medical report –if you have one- and ask for it to be included in the complaint.
 • You can call Nazra for Feminist Studies for legal and psychological support: 01011910917. Nazra will send you a trained lawyer if available. 
 • Make sure to state everything that happened as is. You have the right to give your statement in a separate space than the one the harasser is held in.
 • Write down the complaint number and follow up on the investigation.
 • If someone refused to help you at the police station, call the Ministry of Interior hotline: 138 and report the incident. 
 • If you are injured and/or need a medical report, head to nearest hospital listed and ask to be directed to the emergency room, get checked out and ask for a medical report.
 • If you feel you need to talk to a professional, you can call Al-Nadeem Institute for psychological support: 01006662404 
 • You can call Nazra for Feminist Studies for psychological support: 01011910917 
 • In a couple of days, you should go to the general investigation office and you will tell your statement again with your lawyer.
I have been sexually harassed and I filed a report at the police station, what should I do?

• You can call Nazra for Feminist Studies for legal and psychological support: 01011910917. Nazra will send you a trained lawyer if available. 
 • Make sure to state everything that happened as is. You have the right to give your statement in a separate space than the one the harasser is held in.
 • Write down the complaint number and follow up on the investigation.
 • If someone refused to help you at the police station, call the Ministry of Interior hotline: 138 and report the incident. 
 • If you are injured and/or need a medical report, head to nearest hospital listed and ask to be directed to the emergency room, get checked out and ask for a medical report.
 • If you feel you need to talk to a professional, you can call Al-Nadeem Institute for psychological support: 01006662404 
 • You can call Nazra for Feminist Studies for psychological support: 01011910917 
 • In a couple of days, you should go to the general investigation office and you will tell your statement again with your lawyer.
 • Follow your lawyer’s instructions and don’t ever take back you statement. 
 • If you are threatened or harassed by the family of the harasser, communicate with your lawyer and file a restraining order against them.
 • Follow up with your case number until the case reaches courts and the harasser gets a sentence.
I have been sexually harassed and I have physical injuries, what should I do?

• We will send a distress signal, we will look for nearby advocates and your trusted contacts will also be notified.
 • Meanwhile, follow our instructions.
 • If you are hurt and need medical attention please, head to the nearest hospital to get medical help and file a medical report.
 • You can always go to the nearest police station and file and official “Sexual Harassment” Complaint.
I have been sexually harassed and I need to talk to someone, what should I do?

• We will send a distress signal, we will look for nearby advocates and your trusted contacts will also be notified.
 • Meanwhile, follow our instructions.
 • If you are hurt and need medical attention please, head to the nearest hospital to get medical help and file a medical report.
 • You can always go to the nearest police station and file and official “Sexual Harassment” Complaint.
Hey,I am your street pal. \n What is wrong?
I think I am being followed by someone
Do your surroundings feel safe? Do you think people around you might help?

- Confront the possible threat and establish eye contact. 
 - Remember your voice is a very powerful weapon, so use it more. 
 - You can inquire in a direct and firm tone by asking: “Is something wrong? - You keep looking at me, do I know you?” 
 - Remember, your safety comes first. You DO NOT have to do anything that might endanger you. 

Are you safe now?
We are glad you are safe and sound
We will navigate you to full guide, Tap Go To Guide below
We are going to send an alert to your trusted contacts to notify them about your situation, Tap Go to map button to select a safe place and navigate to it
